title: Carlton Davis gives his pitch for free agents to join Patriots this offseason
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Carlton Davis praises the New England Patriots' culture and organization as appealing to potential free agents.
The Patriots, with a Super Bowl appearance and strong leadership, aim to attract top free agents this offseason.
The 2026 free agent class includes notable talents like receiver George Pickens and edge rusher Jaelan Phillips.

title: Where does Milton Williams rank among Patriots’ 10 best free-agent signings ever?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Milton Williams ranks 8th among Patriots' top 10 free-agent signings, earning $104 million over four years.
Williams has 5.5 sacks this season and recorded six quick pressures in the postseason, second only to Aaron Donald.
Williams' impact on the team's defense was evident, as Patriots struggled during his five-game injury absence.

title: 8 lesser discussed potential trade deadline candidates that could make sense for Celtics
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics aim to add players without major roster changes before Thursday's NBA trade deadline.
Nets' center Nic Claxton could address Celtics' big man needs; interest confirmed by NBA insider Jake Fischer.
Potential Celtics targets include Daniel Gafford, Keon Ellis, Yyves Missi, Dayâ€™Ron Sharpe, and others.

title: Something in the Way Fest 2026: Live updates from Roadrunner
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Something in the Way Fest 2026 brings two dozen indie and alt-rock bands to Roadrunner, Boston, on Jan. 31 and Feb. 1.
Explosions in the Sky headlines with a 90-minute instrumental set, delivering emotional, atmospheric performances as the festival finale.
Brooklyn-based Momma sold merchandise benefiting the Immigrant Law Center of Minnesota, blending pop and indie rock influences in their set.

title: Why the Bruins practiced in a tent on Saturday in Florida
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Bruins practiced inside a tent at Raymond James Stadium on Saturday to prepare for the Stadium Series game.
A state-of-the-art tent kept ice intact by using refrigeration and dehumidification systems despite Florida's weather conditions.
Sunday's puck drop is forecasted to be in the 30s, despite an average Tampa February high of 71 degrees.

title: Boston ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest must-see moments
author: Annie Jonas and Samantha Genzer
bullets: Thousands protested in Boston Common against cooperation with ICE, advocating for immigrant protections and ending deportation practices.
The protest was organized by local advocacy groups as part of a nationwide campaign across 300 cities, reacting to recent ICE-related deaths.
Massachusetts politicians face pressure from protesters to limit ICE operations and prioritize immigrant community protections.

title: Photos from Boston’s ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Over 1,000 people protested against Trump's immigration policies at Boston Common in freezing temperatures.
The protest, part of a national series, was organized by Mass 50501 and local groups.
Participants included a band and various protesters with signs, gathered at the State House steps.

title: Insider believes Red Sox have ‘another move in them’ this offseason to improve infield
author: Conor Roche
bullets: ESPN's Jeff Passan believes the Red Sox may still make a trade to address their infield needs this offseason.
Isaac Paredes is speculated as a trade target, but Boston may face challenges acquiring him from the Astros.
The Red Sox have shown interest in Nico Hoerner and Matt Shaw from the Cubs, but trades are uncertain.

title: Even Drake Maye’s dad is surprised by Patriots’ Super Bowl run
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots' surprise run to Super Bowl LX included a 14-3 record after back-to-back 4-13 seasons.
Quarterback Drake Maye led the league in completion percentage, yards per attempt, and passer rating in 2025.
Drake Maye's father, Mark Maye, expressed surprise at Patriots' performance, despite seeing playoff potential.

title: That guy on TV, Cris Collinsworth, will look familiar to Patriots fans tuning into NBC to watch the Super Bowl
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Cris Collinsworth and Mike Tirico will call Super Bowl LX for NBC, marking Collinsworth's sixth Patriots Super Bowl broadcast.
Collinsworth has broadcasted several defining Patriots games, including victories over Buffalo, Baltimore, and the Chargers this season.
Collinsworth will call his 53rd Patriots game in Super Bowl LX, having covered two Patriots' Super Bowl wins and two losses.
